title: What are some of the best free and paid SEO tools? - Quora

response.answer_text: The Great Tools are given here which are mostly used: 1. Google Search Console: Analogous to BWT (yet much richer), Google Search Console – formerly “Google Webmaster Tools” – provides data and configuration control for your site in Google. That’s a pretty big deal. For more, check out our extensive guide. 2. Google Analytics: The most valuable SEO data is that which helps you understand your visitors  and how they interact with your site.  No tool I’ve used delivers that data like  Google Analytics, and none of the tools I mentioned does a better job providing data that helps you understand the number that matters most – the bottom line. 3.Keywords analysis tool : Google Keyword Planner: Google’s Keyword Planner, the tool formerly known as Adwords Keyword Tool, lets you pull monthly Google search query volume estimates for dozens of keywords in seconds. I can never understate the importance of knowing what people search for. Screaming Frog: Screaming Frog is a website crawler designed specifically for SEO. Within mere minutes, you’ll get critical data on every URL. Best to just download it and take it for a spin. Once you see all that data, you’ll have questions. Other Tool: 1. Wordstream: The Wordstream Free Keyword Tool offers thousands of keyword ideas from a huge database of more than a trillion unique searches. This tool outperforms some of the paid alternatives in the market 2. Copyscape: Copyscape is a free plagiarism checker. The software lets you enter a URL to detect duplicate content and to verify that your content is original. 3. Robots.txt Generator: Robots.txt Generator is a freeware utility that makes the creation of robots.txt files a breeze. 4. XML Sitemap Generators: XML Sitemap Generators create "web-type" XML sitemap and URL-list files (some may also support other formats). 5. GTmetrix: Having a tool to examine page speed and diagnose opportunities for improvement  is now an essential part of the SEO toolkit. Anything that impacts user-experience impacts SEO, and site speed is a big deal for UX, especially for mobile.we have found GTmetrix reliable and a good balance between thorough and user-friendly. Other page speed tools that are good include  Pingdom, WebPagetest (great visual waterfall), and Google PageSpeed Insights. That last one is especially good.  6. Web Developer Toolbar: The Web Developer Toolbar has become much relied-upon during the technical phase of our SEO audits. 7.SEO Quake Toolbar: SEO Quake shows data on traffic, links, social shares, on-page keyword optimization and more. The SEO Quake website has lots of helpful tips on what to do with all this data. 8. Hootsuite: In 2015, social media is typically vital to SEO success. Hootsuite is one of many platforms for managing social media. I’m not saying Hootsuite is the best social platform, but it is what I’m most familiar with and is plenty helpful for promoting new content and staying on top of opportunities to engage with key influencers. 9. Chrome Developer Tools: “F12” is now the SEO button, because it is the shortcut to major awesomeness built right into Chrome. Some SEO tasks you can do with Chrome DevTools include: examining mobile UX and SEO with the amazing mobile emulator, diagnosing page speed, picking apart source code, examining HTTP status codes, and mocking-up live edits to a webpage (including the title tags and Meta descriptions in the SERPs). Resources below.  My Favorite SEO Tools isn’t an SEO Tool | AJ KohnDiscover DevTools | CodeSchoolChrome DevTools  Hacks for Digital Marketers | Distilled10: Bing Webmaster Tools: Other Keywords checker Tool: 1. Keywordtool.io:  Keywordtool.io is great for generating a ton of keyword ideas containing your seed term, especially long-tail keywords that won’t show up in the AdWords keyword tool due to having  very low volumes. I usually use Keywordtool.io when I am building a list of potential keywords, especially when I need long-tail keywords. 2. SEMrush: SEMrush shows data on paid and organic traffic and keywords. It is accessible through the SEObook and SEOQuake Toolbars.live-keyword-analysis.com  Audit report Tool:  1. Woorank:Woorank tool is basically use for Create audit Report.2. seo site checkup: 3. site-analyzer4. chkme 5. moz6. SEMrush: SEMrush shows data on paid and organic traffic and keywords. It is accessible through the SEObook and SEOQuake Toolbars.7. seorch.eu8. hotjar9. spyfu Comptitors Analysis Report:   internetmarketingninjasSEMrushTo check Information:  whoisicann.org Hosting Information :  https://www.whois.net/whoishostingthishttp://webhosting.info/Alexa Rank checker: alexa is powerfull tool to check alexa arank

There are a lot of free and paid SEO tools in the market. There are almost all the SEO tools that have a free version and a paid version. In fact, Google analytics has a paid version too. But you have asked the best tools than have a look at the list below. Spyfu - It can help you to track down the competitor's most profitable keywords.Serpstat - Growth hacking tool for Content marketing and tracking keywords of competitors.Ubersuggest - Finding the keywords based on the competitor URL, check their backlinks and SEO difficulty for ranking a keyword.Gtmetrix- Helps you to reduce the loading time of your website.ScreamingFrog - Great tool for technical SEO, auditing your site and to fix your website errors.SEO Powersuite: Much better for tracking the ranking of keywords, backlinks.MOZ - A must-have tool for backlinking.Google Analytics - A free tool and probably one of the best tools which provide a lot of information about improving your website and track the visitors.Thank you.
